content: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)
linkedContent: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)

content: cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]

content: Nancy: sublime occurs on edge of art

content: Derrida yielded to Adami (hooked like a fish [hostage]), as if his angular signature was waiting for me [Derrida], a stupefying advance > it became Derrida's business, made him speak
linkedContent: Derrida yielded to Adami (hooked like a fish [hostage]), as if his angular signature was waiting for me [Derrida], a stupefying advance > it became Derrida's business, made him speak

content: the phrase “what both cuts me off and prompts me (me souffle) w/ all the rest” performs, does what it says it’s doing: framing borders are jumped, margins saturated en abyme
linkedContent: the phrase “what both cuts me off and prompts me (me souffle) w/ all the rest” performs, does what it says it’s doing: framing borders are jumped, margins saturated en abyme

content: bait (amorce) for Christic phallus (Ichthys): track, graph or trace (Ichnos) of a voiceless bit (mors), Derrida translates title of Adami’s picture [on Glas] as Ich [I’m exhibiting Ich—as an other] ——Adami’s Glas: double column, double bind (bound by fastener called a spiral)—codicarium? quaternarium?; Glas takes its call from scarcely articulable gl
linkedContent: bait (amorce) for Christic phallus (Ichthys): track, graph or trace (Ichnos) of a voiceless bit (mors), Derrida translates title of Adami’s picture [on Glas] as Ich [I’m exhibiting Ich—as an other] ——Adami’s Glas: double column, double bind (bound by fastener called a spiral)—codicarium? quaternarium?; Glas takes its call from scarcely articulable gl

content: what is detached from my signature, da, a piece (morceau) of the other’s name, one of the most obsessive motifs in Glas ——plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature > each letter, bit or piece of word (mors ou morceau de mot) written w/ 2 hands, twice two hands, on each page

content: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials

content: gl of “angle”: wild, almost unnarratable event, not a morpheme, close to piercing (trouer) a hole in the arthron [articulation, joint], patch of color in graphesis, the trait in color, a rebel to appeased commerce (regulated exchange of 2 elements [lexical, pictural])

content: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche
